IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: Focus of Supplemental Report: Initial Report Suspect: Name: John Filistovich DOB: 7/15/1963 Address: 506B Thornberry Court, Lakewood, New Jersey Phone: N/A Narrative: On Wednesday, May 31st, 2023, at approximately 1230 hours, I, Cpl. Connor Willey #6592 of the Maryland State Police Homicide Unit was contacted by Investigators from the Lakewood Police and Ocean County Prosecutors office located in New Jersey. Lakewood Police investigators advised they were actively conducting a stolen vehicle/homicide investigation that occurred on May 30th, 2023 at 506B Thornberry Court, Lakewood, New Jersey. Lakewood Police were able to identify a suspect, John Filistovich (W/M DOB 7/15/1963) and obtain a warrant for his arrest. Filistovich was apprehended by the Maryland State Police Berlin Barrack located in Worcester County, Maryland after having a mental episode and transported to TidalHealth located in Salisbury, Maryland for evaluation. Filistovich was found to be in possession of the vehicle he had stolen, belonging to girlfriend, Betty Perry. On May 31, 2023 at approximately 1506 hours, the honorable David Martz of the District Court for Wicomico County signed a search and seizure warrant for the vehicle described as a 2015 silver Hyundai Elantra with New Jersey Registration L86SBE as well as an additional search and seizure warrant for John Filistovichs person. The search warrant for the vehicle was executed and transferred to the custody of the Lakewood Police Department. After executing a search and seizure warrant for Filistovichs person, the following items were seized: 1) Brown boots 2) Red jacket 3) Black pants 4) Dark colored shirt 5) DC shirt 6) Camo thermal 7) Blue shirt 8) Black sweatpants 9) Black jeans 10) Lifestyle condoms 11) Condoms 12) Eye lash 13) Metal wallet with assorted cards 14) Michael Kors wallet 15) Assorted jewelry and watches 16) 4 cell phones - tcl, att, sch(symbol)K, black cell phone 17) (3) watches 18) Currency 19) Debit MasterCard belonging to betty Perry 20) Phone charger 21) Pocket knifes 22) Straight razor 23) Several t-shirt that were being worn by Filistovich These above items were turned over the investigators of the Lakewood Police for further investigation. All events occurred in Wicomico County, Maryland. Case closed.
